author: michaelamadi
content: i think i've seen this before but want to re-ask. Shouldn't this be false? https://github.com/ethereum/tests/blob/e46e1db503ee2711ad02e1f5b3ea45d43e9cd8cb/EOFTests/efExample/validInvalid.json#L22

author: michaelamadi
content: given that data is meant to be 4 bytes but what's available after the code section is only 2 bytes

author: gurukamath
content: “data body length may be shorter than data_size for a not yet deployed container”

author: michaelamadi
content: ah i see thanks. so all test bytecodes are assumed to be undeployed containers, right?

author: _shemnon
content: I woudn't trust a test that is not in the EEST repository, they haven't been updated since a few critical spec changes have happened.  A container can be truncated only if it is a subcontainer and it is the target of a RETURNCONTRACT operation.  So top level containers must be full length.
